column5: Took a hike in the rouge today and came across a deer that was lying down on some reeds across the river and was bleeding from its mouth or chest. The river is not frozen over so i could not get any closer to the deer to see exactly what was wrong with him.The deer was alert but for the hour i was watchin him he never got up once..
Call Animal Control now and they'll go help it or put it out of its misery!  Joey
Let nature take it,s couse J. I know it may sound cruel to some,but Im sure it will be taken care of, mother natures way.
I'm sure the coyotes have already taken care of it....

Gonna try to get to the otherside of the river today... I have heard of illegal hunting in the rouge and i wanna see if its got a bow in its chest. A friend of mine found a deer carcuss with a bow stuck in its side last year. I will let u guys know what i find.

Found a dead deer at the old mill a few weeks back, next day all that was left were bones, coyotes tore it apart overnight.  not sure how it died, called animal services they came and took away the remaining pieces.

Had a couple zoo workers come down and check to see what I was doing once..  Seems someone had been in the valley snaring deer.  Wouldn't be the slightest bit surprised if someone took a shot at that doe..  I'd say keep your eyes and ears peeled!!
